node.title: Police probe underway after Brian Tamaki speaks at Christchurch anti-vaccine protest
node.description: But Destiny Church is describing the event as a picnic, not a protest.
node.content: ["By Niva Chittock of RNZ\n", "Police are investigating an anti-COVID vaccine protest attended by Destiny Church leader Brian Tamaki.", "A Destiny Church spokesperson confirmed Tamaki visited Christchurch at the weekend to give the Sunday sermon at the local congregation.", "Tamaki also spoke at an event on Saturday, which the spokesperson described as a picnic, not an anti-vaccine mandate protest.", "The spokesperson said once they learnt of Tamaki's visit, they asked him to speak at Saturday's event in Hagley Park.", "Canterbury police district commander Supt John Price said enforcement action may be taken if breaches of COVID-19 rules are found.", "Tamaki has been charged three times after speaking at large protests in breach of Auckland's level three rules.", "At the time of the first event, gatherings were restricted to a maximum of 10 people. There were about 1000 people at the protests.", "\"We encourage individuals attending protests to conduct themselves in a safe manner and adhere to current COVID-19 orange restrictions, which are there to ensure the safety of all,\" Price said.", "Destiny Church regularly meets in Christchurch's Cranmer Square for its weekend sermon.", "RNZ"]
